results.description:
PLEASE NOTE:
WE ARE AN ONGOING GROUP WITH MEMBERS WHO DO NOT REGISTER ON MEETUP.
SO - IF YOU'RE INTERESTED - PLEASE COME, EVEN IF YOU DON'T SEE OTHERS SIGNED UP FOR A GIVEN SUNDAY. THANKS!!!

We practice mindfulness meditation and principally follow the Zen tradition of Thich Nhat Hanh. We also explore the wisdom from other wonderful teachers.

Cultivating mindfulness means paying attention to what is going on inside of us and around us. Too often we live in forgetfulness - our body is in one place but our mind is lost somewhere else. When we bring mindfulness into our everyday life - to our thoughts, emotions, speech and actions - we are able to embrace all aspects of ourselves, better able to deal with anger and other negative emotions, and can experience life more fully.

www.facebook.com/SunOfAwareness

We meet regularly on Sunday mornings, 9:00-10:30am, at Yoga Shunya studio: 275 Grove Street, 3rd Floor (across from City Hall).

Beginning meditators - and those with no experience - are always welcome. Donation is optional ($5-10 suggested) to support the yoga studio. Cushions, mats, and chairs are all provided. Just wear comfortable clothes for sitting and walking!

Come whenever you can -- We'd love to meet you!

==========================================================

Note: While our group is new on Meetup, we have been gathering regularly since 2009. And now we're focused on letting more people know about us!
results.name: Sun of Awareness - Mindfulness Meditation in Jersey City

results.description:
WHY TOASTMASTERS? 

Today’s business environment is more competitive than ever. Technical skills no longer determine who sets the pace. It’s strong communication and leadership skills that will push you to the front of the pack. 

These are skills you can refine as a member of a Toastmasters club. And best of all, since it is a mutually supportive and positive learning environment, protective gear is not necessary.

Give your career a boost - join Toastmasters today! Stay ahead of the pack!


WHAT IS 730 TOASTMASTER CLUB? 

We are a local New York Toastmasters Club - part of the broader Toastmasters clubs family. We operate under the same high Toastmasters International standards and deliver a great, fun, save environment to practice your public speaking. We meet at TIAA-CREF location on 730 Third Avenue in New York - a short walk from Grand Central. We meet two times a month on the 1st and 3rd Thursday from 12:00-1:00 and an optional happy hour on the 3rd Thursday from 5:30-6:30 at a nearby location.  

You can test-drive the experience as a guest at first and determine if is something you want to commit to by joining the Toastmasters as an official member. 

The events currently on the calendar will be posted in the community. Please sign-up for those you can make it so we can plan for the space and track attendance. 

For more information please email: Toastmasters_NY@tiaa-cref.org .

Visit our Facebook group as well:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/730toastmasters/


WANT MORE INFO? KEEP READING

What is Toastmasters?

No, we don't make toasters!

From a humble beginning in 1924 at the YMCA in Santa Ana, California, Toastmasters International has grown to become a world leader in helping people become more competent and comfortable in front of an audience. The nonprofit organization now has nearly 270,000 members in more than 13,000 clubs in 110 countries, offering a proven – and enjoyable! – way to practice and hone communication and leadership skills.

Most Toastmasters meetings are comprised of approximately 20 people who meet weekly for an hour or two. Participants practice and learn skills by filling a meeting role, ranging from giving a prepared speech or an impromptu one to serving as timer, evaluator or grammarian.

There is no instructor; instead, each speech and meeting is critiqued by a member in a positive manner, focusing on what was done right and what could be improved.

Why Join?

Survey after survey shows that presentation skills are crucial to success in the workplace. Many people pay high fees for seminars to gain the skill and confidence necessary to face an audience. Toastmasters’ provides an option that is less expensive and held in high regard in business circles. This organization has been around for more than 84 years and offers a proven – and enjoyable – way to practice and hone communication and leadership skills.

You will…

·  Learn to communicate more effectively 

·  Become a better listener. 

·  Improve your presentation skills 

·  Increase your leadership potential 

·  Become more successful in your career 

·  Build your ability to motivate and persuade 

·  Reach your professional and personal goals 

·  Increase your self confidence.

How you do it.

·  Build speaking and leadership skills with time-tested methods 

·  Focus on areas of interest in our self-paced curriculum 

·  Receive suggestions for improvement through constructive evaluations

Toastmasters programs are . . .

·  Inexpensive 

·  Interactive 

·  Convenient 

·  Friendly 

·  Supportive

More than four million people have discovered the benefits of this proven learning formula. What are you waiting for?

Become a Member

Email:  Toastmasters_NY@tiaa-cref.org

·  Each group has a different personality – you may wish to visit more than one.  Go to http://www.toastmasters.org/ and use the “Find a Club tool” to find meetings near you.  Call or e-mail in advance (if possible) to confirm meeting time and location.

Ready for the next step?

·  After you attend a meeting, you can apply for membership (minimum age 18.)

·  At the meeting, ask for a membership application.

·  Membership is affordable, and if you are an employee of TIAA-CREF, the dues are covered through your total benefits package.

·  $20 new member fee (one time fee)

·  Toastmaster International half-year membership dues are $36 plus a one-time $20 fee for your new member kit. 

·  The VP Membership will send your application and fees to Toastmasters’ World Headquarters.

·  Your New Member Kit should arrive in the mail in about 10 days.

Toastmaster's Promise

As a member of Toastmasters International and my club, I promise...

·  To attend club meetings regularly

·  To prepare all of my speech and leadership projects to the best of my ability, basing them on projects in the Competent Communication, Advanced Communication or Competent Leadership manuals

·  To prepare for and fulfill meeting assignments

·  To provide fellow members with helpful, constructive evaluations

·  To help the club maintain the positive, friendly environment necessary for all members to learn and grow

·  To serve my club as an officer when called upon to do so

·  To treat my fellow club members and our guests with respect and courtesy

·  To bring guests to club meetings so they can see the benefits Toastmasters membership offers

·  To adhere to the guidelines and rules for all Toastmasters educational and recognition programs

·  To maintain honest and highly ethical standards during the conduct of all Toastmasters activities
results.name: 730 Toastmasters Club

Our vision is to have a monthly networking event where we can meet other amazing people, share ideas and work together in projects to advance the growth of our community in a casual, relaxed, and inviting atmosphere.

Another goal of this group is to support other Latino community related events and projects; take outings together as a group where we can grow professionally and personally, as well as fun excursions and events. We invite all our members to send us your ideas about events, programs, and projects that you would like to see NJLPN take part on.

Some of the suggestions for events have been:

-Suport and attend events at NJPAC and Prudential Center when they have Latino artists performing there -Support professional organizations by attending their events such as Association of Latino Professionals For America - ALPFA, National Society of Hispanic MBAs (NSHMBA), and others -Support events geared towards the Latino community by Rutgers, Newark Library, and other Institutions of Higher Education

"The currency of real networking is not greed but generosity". - Keith Ferrazzi
results.name: NJ LATINO PROFESSIONALS NETWORK

results.description: We are a group of Marines, first and foremost, that share a passion for rugby. We play together 2-3 times per year to honor the memory of our fallen brothers and teammates that are no longer able to play the game we all love. Our club is open to all who served honorably in the Marine Corps at one time or another and play or love rugby. In 2014, we started the Lt. Col. Kevin M. Shea Memorial Fund, administered to by the Marine Corps Scholarship Foundation, to raise educational support funds for the children of Marines injured or killed in action. Your donation is tax deductible and very much appreciated.
results.name: Old Breed Rugby Club

results.description:
Sistagirls a group for women (20s & 30's+) who simply want to get together with other women to have fun, laugh, and of course build lasting friendships. We aim to bring together fabulous, fierce women for networking and friendships; to be a sisterhood where we support one another in every aspect of life. Our goal is to create empowerment & lasting relationships for members all while having fun. Meetups will include night and day parties, brunches, dinners, museums, shopping, networking, game night, getaways, community service, potlucks, movie-nights, and anything else that seems interesting or fun. Don’t be afraid to suggest an awesome meetup!

Men are not allowed in the group, however sistagirls of all races, ethnicities, and cultures we welcome with open arms!
results.name: Sistagirls NYC

results.description:
This group is dedicated to everyone and anyone who has tried to lose weight, has gotten stuck with emotional attachments towards food, has difficulty establishing "healthy" diets, and is looking to gain support from a community on a path similar to theirs. Weight Loss & Wisdom is a supportive community created by an individual who faced the above circumstances.

The Meetup events will always be different. From hikes and outdoor activities to informational lectures by key speakers on health and nutrition within the community. There will be plenty of variety.

If your looking to reach your goals, gain lifestyle mastery, and experience true growth, look no further because this is the group for you.
results.name: Weight Loss & Wisdom

topics.name: A Course in Miracles Study Group

results.description: The Little Garden is a beginners study group of A Course In Miracles dedicated to recognizing our relationship with god through one another. Our format is structured to introduce and apply the principles and methods of A Course In Miracles in our daily lives. To uncover the principles, we study portions of the text. To apply them, we practice workbook lessons. Each week, we meditate using a workbook lesson, and then study a principle or a workbook lesson, alternating between text and lessons. We also invite students to speak on their experience with a lesson or principle, focusing on a Miracle or Miracles they have experienced. There is no fee to attend; however, a contribution to support the cost of the group is appreciated.
results.name: ACIM -The Little Garden Study Group

results.description:
A crisis continues today in both the New York Courts as well as in the legal services provider community! Thousands of Civil and Supreme Court litigants continue to be unable to find or afford counsel and must appear pro se, without the competency to represent themselves. Moreover, the pro bono legal services provider community is unable to handle the enormous volume of litigants seeking representation. That this shortage of staffing is occurring at the same time that thousands of lawyers are unemployed deserves attention and a solution. Therefore, in order to help address the above structural representation and employment challenges,

917Lawyers Is creating and furthering a community of legal professionals for the purpose of organizing networking meet-ups to enabler participants to discover new public service, pro bono, and career opportunities. At these professionals’ only meet-ups, members will benefit from face to face networking with peers, expanding law firms and legal services providers, and gain knowledge and insight into future
employment as well as pro bono opportunities.

917Lawyers welcomes your thoughts and suggestions by email, and wishes success to all!
results.name: 917LAWYERS CAREER & EMPLOYMENT NETWORK

results.description: In the Bergen County/ New York City area looking for a place to make paper crafts, express yourself, and make new friends all at the same time? This is the meet up for you! In a laid back environment, Hannah will teach you different paper crafting techniques, from decorating notebooks, to making gift tags, greeting cards, and more! Come for the crafts, stay for a fun time!
results.name: The Flourishing Crafters

results.description:
Our team doesn't teach Real Estate Investing we Create Real Estate Investors. In addition to members being taught the latest Investment strategies by wealthy Investors, they are also assigned a Mentor with several years of Real Estate Investing experience. When a member has any questions while implementing the strategies taught, they can ask their mentor, any of the other members, or even the Group at any of our Weekly meetings. With the option to join any of our Daily conference calls, webinars, Weekly in person meetings, Intensive Saturday training courses, online classes, you will finally be engulfed in Real Estate Investing and finally Truly have the option to be Financially Free.

In the big picture we are a National Network of Experienced Real Estate Investors looking to add to our network. This way we can all benefit as we share the different investment opportunities we come across. Our organization has programs for Beginners as well as Experienced Investors, in NY, NJ, CT, as well as 27+ locations around the country.

Right now we are in a Once In a Lifetime buyer's market! When else in our Lifetime, will we see the combination of Below Market property values and Record Low mortgage rates. Working with us will give you the option of Investing Part Time for added income or Quitting your Day Job, Firing Your Boss and becoming a Full Time Investor.

Did you know that there were more Millionaires created through Real Estate than in all other industries combined? Fortune Magazine has predicted that between 2006 and 2016 10,000 Millionaires will be created because of the recession. Our Goal is to do as much as we can to make that prediction come to fruition. With this being the Last year of that prediction...Will You be one of those Millionaires?
results.name: NYC-LEARN Real Estate Investing! Wholesa,F&F,Buy&Hold&Commer

results.description:
This is a group for women with child/ren to meet up and connect with other parents who understand, appreciate, and want to share info and have lots of fun. As a parent it is not possible to hangout and do all the other single life fun with your single friends as much or anymore. We sometimes feel left out a bit from the outside life, we love our families but we need a little bit of us women time from time to time. We will serve as a support system for eachother. From our passions, hobbies, life goal, professions, life, and parenting. Every voice counts, and we will have group discussions on what we would like to see happen next.

This group is a group to come out with the kids and have playdates and activities for the kids, and fun family activies while the grown ups catch up on life, and socialized. Family beach day, mother and child activities, yoga, cooking class, dancing, women spa day and or retreat. Also for the moms to go out with other moms and have a girls night. Go out dancing, bowling, eat out, or have couple's night out. Make new and/ or experienced mom friends, share tips, info, best doctors, daycare, school, acties or just have someone to talk to. Anyone can request or submit information on free or low cost event that would interest the group.

Professional moms, stay at home moms, single mothers, and everyone is welcome. Have a fitness buddy to lose some baby weight, make a best-friend, find a good sitter and vice versa. Moms with children same age group. Learn a new language, culture, best diet remedy, and best place to shop for discount.  Have women night out, couples night out, and single mingle events for single parents, and We will do everything and anything, members are welcomed with suggestions, and takes turn on planning activities. We are moms but have other part of life as well, have another working mom friend, a single mom friend, and etc.

So welcome to Motherhood retreat!
results.name: North Bergen & Areas Moms Meetup

results.description: Meet like minded individuals who want to get fit and lead a healthy living lifestyle. Share nutrition tips and find accountability fitness partners. Meet new friends and get a nice sweaty 30-45 minute workout!

For each meetup we'll be focusing on one segment of the creative industry and its relation to location and space. This includes, film, photography, music, dance, fitness and more.

Our meetups are designed for fun, networking and learning new things from each other about all aspects of the creative industry.

For more information about Spacefy, please visit our website and read our blog.


Social Media Pages: Facebook | Twitter | Instagram | Google+ | Linkedin | tumblr

results.description:
Do you enjoy skiing? Do you want to make more friends that like to ski? What if they happen to be part of the LGBT community?

Well if all of these appeal to you, look no further. We're a group of friends that are looking to find more people to ski with. We're an informal group that will plan some trips and also have some ad-hoc days. No crazy rules or pre-approved snacks, the Pole Planters are just people who like to ski and want more friends to do it with. So join up and make some new ski buddies today!

Currently I am searching for a rehearsal accompanist. Currently I am searching for a venue in which to rehearse, but am considering Chelsea Studios. You should join this meet up if you have a passion for video game music and want to sing with others. Sight reading is not necessary, but is a plus as there will be scores to download. More information to come.

results.description:
Back in 1996, we were excited when we could only find a product in a web store, put it into the cart and have it delivered to our doorsteps. A few years forward, customer reviews and social sharing features made shopping already a lot more fun. Entering the Web 3.0 era, commerce is increasingly melting with content, community and context to create never seen before personal shopping experiences.

With the help of new technology, merchants and brands can analyze their customers’ characteristics and behaviours to engage with them within the context of their needs, desires, preferences, timing and location, to surprise and delight them and build long-lasting customer relationships.

The upcoming ecomhack New York is all about how smartphones, wearables, beacons and other emerging devices enable creating these personal experiences that make shopping more individual, more efficient – and more fun.
results.name: ecomhack New York

results.description: Righteous Bite NYC is a dining club designed for the adventurous foodie of color. Whether you are a native New Yorker or visiting the great metropolis, you will have the advantage of meeting with like minded individuals hungry for the opportunity to try an array of international cuisines from the city's top rated eating establishments. Some of the proceeds will fund some of the city's youth food activism nonprofits.
results.name: Righteous Bite NYC

results.description: If you've ever been drawn to Hinduism, you should definitely meet up with us. We are putting together classes to teach Sanskrit and Vedic Studies. We are working on campaigns to dispel misconceptions about Hinduism, and are even fighting for Hindu Holidays to be given as days off in schools and in the workplace. If any of these things interest you, meet with us!
results.name: Hinduism in NYC - More than just a learning experience...

results.description:
An open mind, a willing heart, and a desire to want something *more* in life is all you need to join us!

I'll be sharing my own personal journey to Freedom and encouraging group discussion as we meet new Fearless friends and support each other in pursuing our goals and dreams!  

I invite YOU to come learn one of the key concepts and self-empowering tools of Fearless Living - a skill that can be used to master emotional Fear in any situation!  We'll also be discussing the way Fear keeps us 'stuck' and learning how to recognize when Fear is actually a marker for growth and opportunity - AND how we can use it to get the things we want!
results.name: Do YOU want to be Fearless?

results.description:
Meet professionals that can help grow your business. Members generate referrals for each other every week. 

We are looking to build a circle of quality professionals through a combination of structured meetings and monthly networking events.
results.name: Fun-Friends-and-Referrals

results.description:
Welcome to the Manhattan International Netball Club, and to playing netball in New York! The Club was established in 2000 by women with a love of netball and a desire to build a network for others who also enjoy the game. The Club membership has grown ten-fold since it was formed and continues to grow rapidly, made up predominantly of fun-loving professional women from overseas – with an emphasis on the fun!

MINC caters to competitive and social players. The Club runs weekly practices in Manhattan and regularly fields three teams at local or national tournaments. The aim of the Club is to allow those who participate at a high level achieve their full potential, while also recognizing that the Club provides a strong social network for its members. It balances these aims by having committees focused on coaching and development, as well as committees focused upon social events.

We welcome players of all abilities at all times of the year, so what are you waiting for? Contact our membership secretary, Sue, and come and try it out!
results.name: Manhattan International Netball Club

results.description:
Hey, nonprofit & startup professionals! Let's face it, looks matter. Whether you're in search of a prospective donor or client, you need to follow best design practices to be both noticed and understood. We're founded on the simple philosophy that design needs to be considered now so you'll have a more consistent brand later. But, we get that it might not make sense to take on a huge branding project before you have the funds or knowledge of your brand to back it up. That's where we come in.

We'll give you industry-tailored tools to follow simple design practices now at a rate you can afford. (We can tackle the big branding stuff later.) It's time for smart design to meet smart business.

It's our hope that in addition to connecting you with our classes, this meetup can serve as a discussion about local resources and tools, from printers and design tools to foundation funding and incubators.
results.name: Spark: Design Education for Startups & Nonprofits

results.description:
If you're a woman career professional, a mom transitioning back into the workforce or a mom who needs support to balance work and life, a woman entrepreneur who's juggling just about all she can juggle... or a woman who simply wants to experience support and empowerment through coaching, join the NY/NJ Echoes Coaching Circle Meetup!

EchoesTM Coaching Circles are Directed by the group and the Facilitator in a way that is helpful to each individual. Each circle is:

• A space for learning about yourself within the context of a group and/or a team
• A space to gather relevant information about your own approach to different situations by receiving feedback from circle members
• A space to tackle hard decisions, challenging situations, and gain varying perspectives from others 
• A space to be encouraged to take steps in scary situations
• A space to obtain tools on how to communicate better through role playing and other activities 
• A space to learn techniques to transfer into your life across the spheres
• A space to decompose and recompose the emotionality behind your approach to different situations and to understand how to manage this emotionality and use it to your advantage
• A space to develop a keen understanding about boundaries and the relevance of saying “No” or “Yes”
• A space to fine-tune verbal and gestural expression, and to become comfortable with being a consummate communicator
results.name: NY/NJ Echoes Coaching Circle Meetup

results.description: Meetup Pro puts the power of Meetup to work for your organization. Businesses use Meetup to educate and inspire their communities, drive engagement, and build real relationships with members at the local level. Meetup Pro organizers build chapters of branded Meetups, and appoint local leadership teams to run things on the ground in each city. This Meetup is intended to connect Meetup Pro organizers in New York to share ideas, support one another, and have fun.

results.description: This is an IBM sponsored PaaS meetup group. Geared towards developers, architects and all Cloud Foundry and Bluemix enthusiasts, we learn about Bluemix hands on with fellow developers. Learn how to use this PaaS product with the current apps. Our meetups are free.
results.name: Bluemix: Pittsburgh PaaS and Cloud Computing Meetup

results.description: Are you a woman who is single by choice (or not) who needs the support of other single women?  Are you navigating the ups & downs of online dating or dating ( in general)?  Are you interested in meeting like-minded women? I'm a certified health and wellness coach (who also happens to be single) and  am navigating the joys (Yay! I can watch whatever I want on T.V.) and the struggles (ohh...the holidays are here again) of being single.  We will get together to vent, laugh, support, and honor each other's journey. We will also spend time talking about ways to nurture our minds, bodies, & spirits.
results.name: Savvy Singles Women's Support and Wellness Group

results.description: This is a group for Mental Health Professionals in Private Practice looking to connect! This community is both social and educational; offering laid back conversation and also keeping up to date on the latest in our field. Connecting with each other can also be a segue to peer supervision, clinical referrals, shared knowledge, and expanding our inner circles- both for us and for our clients. Hope to see you!

To gather a core of competent musicians [Active] with good people skills to assist, inspire, direct and motivate musicians at a monthly Meet and Greet which is held at a local eatery or restaurant, after we've learn a bit about our new members goals/aspirations, our group will head to a prepaid studio for the rehearsal/Jam. Guide and resources for entrepreneurship. Networking events! Service offers coaching and mentoring for fee. This group is for all looking to connect with others to reach the next level.

Available for speaking engagements.

topics.name: Break-up Recovery: Moving On after the Break
Separation & Divorce Support for Men and Women

results.description:
Divorce is one of the most emotionally difficult experiences you will face. We all need support, encouragement and something to look forward to as we go through these challenging times. This group is designed to work with men and women considering divorce, in the midst of the process or post divorced who are seeking support and guidance to move forward.

In each session, you will find support and validation, be coached through your fears and guided to overcome your obstacles; and challenged to set new goals to begin to move forward. You will develop a community of friends who share your struggles and understand your pain and dreams.

We will be consistently inviting and encouraging you to embark on a journey of surviving, discovering, embracing, dreaming and living full out.
results.name: Journey Beyond Divorce - Bergen Rockland

results.description:
Join other cross gender people on a monthly basis to socialize and view Transgender themed films.  Refreshments and post-movie discussion included.
Doors open at 6pm, Film rolls at 7:30pm. Transgender people, their friends and lovers are welcome to this free event at the CDI Empowerment center on West 47th Street. 

CDI is a social and support organization that was founded 25 years ago.  It's mission is to help Cross Gender individuals to develop their feminine presentation and mannerisms in a safe, supportive, nonjudgmental group environment.

Event attendance is limited to 25 people.
results.name: Movie night @  CDI

results.description:
So what’s so special about the Nordics? Maybe the fact that it has created almost 10% of the global unicorns in the past 10 years while only accounting for 2% of the GDP. It’s home for companies like Skype, Spotify, Supercell, Zendesk, Unity and the list goes on.

These Nordic meetups are aimed at everyone from the Nordics or with an interest in the region! We can guarantee that you’ll find a bunch of entrepreneurially minded people well connected to the Nordic startup and tech ecosystem here.

And it wouldn't be a proper Nordic Startup meetup without free beer!

We meet once a month on a Tuesday in a private room from 6-8:30pm.

results.description:
The purpose for this group to meet new people who are on the same path as I am. Entrepreneurs are always looking to collaborate and learn from others who are having success in their chosen field. So at our meetings we will be discussing what is working in our lives so we can help the group continue to grow and prosper. 

We are looking for people with a burning desire to succeed, who are driven to achieve success, who are willing to share, help others grow and develop and have a burning desire for what they want in life. 

If your someone who is looking for a more enriched life to make some positive changes in your life and lives of others thats what this group is about.  Napoleon Hill talks about creating a mastermind of people to help us find the answers in our lives. This is the inspiration for the group. I look forward to seeing everyone soon.

results.description: You’re ready to put pen to paper. You have folders full of ideas. You might have drafts written. But you need that extra push, you need deadlines, and you need something to hold you accountable so you can take those next steps.
results.name: NYC Writers Room

results.description:
Are you tired of living paycheck to paycheck?
Could you use more money to help pay for the things you need and want in your life?
Do you think you have the potential to make more money?

If you answered yes to any of these questions, then you belong in our group. We have been working with seasoned professionals who have figured out how to make more money and want to give back to the community. Join us to tap into this knowledge and make a better life for you and your family.

One of the most important rules we have learned about making money is to share the knowledge with others to help THEM make money. The fastest way to make money is to help others make money.  We also strongly believe in the practice of tithing.  If you are helping others while making money it is not only very rewarding, but it inspires you to make MORE money to help MORE people.

There are SO many ways to make money and this is the place we will share them with you.  There is plenty of money to be made in this world.  There is no need to take advantage of others or do anything illegal.  In our group, we learn to live life abundantly because ABUNDANCE is our mindset.
results.name: New Jersey Money Makers

results.description:
This Meetup is for those who are seeking to enhance their face and/or body. It's all about feeling great and looking great! Be the best that you can be and connect with those who are interested in all aspects of beauty and healthy living!

When you feel beautiful, you are beautiful!

New York Beauty invites everyone who is interested in beauty, health, wellness, fashion and New York living to join our group.

We will be doing brunch, lunch, dinner, day trips, cruises, healthy activities and holding talks, seminars, parties and more!

Meet people in New York who are interested in beautiful, healthy, happy living!
results.name: New York Beauty

results.description: Web Design / Development is not an easy job anymore. We, the web people have various difficulties & challenges ranging from less knowledgable clients to readymade themes & DIY services making you feel unwanted in the web industry. So, lets meet up at the most creative city in the world and find a way to help each other. Lets discuss our issues and find a way to get through it. This is all what we want to do at DOWP. ANALYZE / DISCUSS / SOLVE
results.name: Difficulties Of Web People (DOWP)

results.description:
The Freakdog Workshop is an active, on-going series led by Josh Rowe where performers are conditioned to take pleasure in executing actions. In this drop-in class, actors craft detailed experiences for themselves, and practice lending their bodies and voices fully to the will of intention in a safe, supportive environment.

Each class includes exercises designed to ignite your imagination, provide a platform for the voice and cultivate interesting behavior. Actors will be able to apply the skills they develop directly to auditions and characters.

These special installments are being offered free for all participants.
results.name: The Freakdog Workshop @ The Williamsburgh Library

results.description:
Let`s meet new people and do unusual things. This group will expose you to so many things you may never even knew existed. The best part is that this group holds interesting things for singles, couples, all age ranges, first timers, or the experienced who seeks to do it again. Don't worry about coming out alone, that's what most people do... We'll make sure that you have an opportunity to socialize and hopefully go home meeting tons of people and even make a few friends.

Some events include: Snowboarding & Skiing, Rafting, Sky Diving, Wine Tasting, Paint Ball, Dance Classes, Horse Back Riding, Gun Shooting, Archery, Fishing, Hiking, Skating, Rock Climbing, BINGO, Fruit Picking, Cooking Classes, Fly Helicopters, Fencing, Snowboarding, Bowling, Trapeze School, Happy Hour and anything else you can think of.
results.name: Travel + Leisure

results.description:
Objective-C and Java are scary! But, life doesn't have to be like that. There are several development tools that can create apps using visual layout of the interface, and easier to understand syntax to do the coding. If you ever go to Meetups because you have an idea for an app, but you find yourself being completely confused by the technicalities of the presentation, you should come to this Meetup instead!

The range of presentations will be anything from looking at Swift 2 and other add-ons that make Xcode easier to use, through to Photoshop techniques. Basically, anything that is useful to know when developing web, desktop, or mobile apps. Each meeting would consist of perhaps three 30 minute presentations, leaving plenty of time for networking.
results.name: NYCoders App Development Meetup

results.description:
We are two young, NYC ladies who love taking our knitting, crochet, embroidery, paper crafts, etc. to coffee shops/bars and crafting with a beverage well within reach! We're looking for similar-minded folk to join us and share our love of crafts/drink/great conversation. If you aren't yet a crafter but are interested in learning a new skill, we're happy to teach! Just let us know what you want to learn beforehand and we can tell you what to bring to the meeting. CATS meetings on weeknights will typically be in Manhattan, but on weekends we're excited to explore Brooklyn and Queens! We typically go to coffee shops or bars (or some combination of the two) but we're open to parks, restaurants, etc --just let us know if you have an idea for a new location.

*CATS is a great acronym but we are also into beer (CABS?), coffee (CACS?) and wine (CAWS?)
results.name: NYC Craft & Tea* Society (CATS)

results.description:
Please note:  Do not request membership if you do not have a clear and real [PHOTO] of yourself in profile at the time of membership request. Cats, animals and inanimate objects DO NOT count. This is a requirement of membership. You will be DENIED membership. Repeat membership requests without following the aforementioned will lead to you being banned. Thank you for your cooperation.

Welcome the Tennis Social group for Asian and Asian Americans. If you are not of Asian descent please consider joining the many other tennis groups in the area.

Whether you are an absolute beginner to advanced player we welcome all levels of tennis enthusiasts, so long as you are willing to put the sweat and effort into improving your game and helping others improve theirs.

It is often hard to find a steady "hitting" partner which radically improves your game and gives motivation and encouragement to pound the pavement on a consistent basis. So this group is also a place to find someone to hit with at your level or desired level. Please do not harass members if they do not wish to hit with you. Offenders will be banned. Please report abuse to Organizers.

You should own your own racket and bring balls. When an event is organized please honor your RSVPs. We will find free courts to play in NJ or NY during the warm seasons, and seek in-door opportunities during the colder months.

We will also gather for social events after practices or on separate occasions or watch tennis matches on TV or go to the US OPEN! We look forward to playing together!

results.description:
Hi everyone! I have been living in Astoria since 2012, and love it! And while I have many friends who live in other parts of the city, I'd love to meet more people within the immediate area.  I imagine there are many other Astorians out there who feel the same way.  As they say... 'Why Leave Astoria?'  ;-)

Most outings will occur within the confines of Astoria, and they will be 'eclectic'. (Only occasionally will I suggest an event outside of Astoria...)  Another feature of this group is that events will be limited to 10 or so people at a time. I want people to truly get to know each other...to have good conversation...I don't want this to feel like a networking/pickup-y/name-tag kind of group. 

Our group (whose  events will be purposefully small in size) is not like other Meetup groups where you can feel anonymous.  Not showing up for events of this size does affect the host and other attendees.  I understand that things happen.  All I ask is that if you can no longer attend, or have a strong sense you will be held up at work or with family issues, that you give me Two Hours notice.  Anyone who simply does not show up or give me sufficient notice that they can no longer make the event (or else who doesn't provide a damn good explanation and profuse apology after the fact ....lol), will have to be removed from the group..  I don't do this to be a taskmaster or anything...it's just very disheartening for me to pay Meetup Organizer dues,  arrange events, provide very detailed information on events to the group, and then for me to arrive at the venue, only to find a bunch of no-shows.  All I ask is for common courtesy.  If you're not prepared to give me that, that you shouldn't join this group.  ;-)  Thank you for your understanding!

Every so often I will arrange for a somewhat larger outing, once I feel that enough good relationships have been created between members of the group.

'YES' to:

- members that are engaging, who have a positive energy, with varied interests, and who are comfortable meeting new people and diving right into conversation!   All profiles must include a clear photo of YOU (no sunglasses, no hat, no fuzzy/long-distance photos, no photos of pets or avatars).

- members who understand our events will generally be small and intimate, and that communicating to the host if you can no longer attend, is expected.   

- events where we support and enjoy both the new AND the old-school establishments of Astoria. (I think it's hugely important to support the small businesses that have been in Astoria for more than a few years, and which seem to be gradually disappearing due to rent increases, etc,)

'NO to:

- joining this group with the sole purpose of hoping to fill that romantic void in your life.  (I prefer members who already consider their lives full and engaging versus people who come to events, scope out the attendees, decide there's no one that 'interests' them, and then they disengage from the group.)  There are plenty of other 'singles' Meetup groups if that's your area of focus.

- joining this group because you see all Meetup members as potential clients for your business, product, etc.

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

I find groups most interesting when they have a good mix of members (singles/couples, straight/gay, younger/older, etc.,) so no one should think this group might not be for them!  I'd like to have members who've already figured out that you can be good friends with people who have different backgrounds from you, different political views, economic backgrounds, much older/younger than you, etc.  What matters most is that we all are people with positive energy, and respect each others' viewpoints.  

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

NOTE:  To help offset the fees that I must pay to Meetup.com each month as a Group Organizer, I'd like to kindly ask for a $2 donation from each member, whenever they attend one of our events.  Thank you!

Thanks for your interest, and hope to see you soon!
results.name: Eclectic Astorians

Our objective is to provide a co-learning environment where specific IT related questions can be asked and proper responses are presented. We aim to guide and mentor aspiring ICT professionals. Furthermore, we intend to: 

- foster collaboration between ICT professionals living on the African continent and those in the diaspora

 - organize Tech Meet-Ups

- have hackathons and code retreats 

- attract underrepresented groups (minority and/or women in low-income communities)

The group is open to anyone interested in sharing knowledge and learning more about technology and how it impacts the African Diaspora.

results.description: KRAV MAGA is a Self Defense system developed for the military in Israel that consist of a wide combination of practical techniques and realistic training scenarios. Ideas in Krav Maga include: Counterattacking as soon as possible (or attacking pre-emptively). Targeting attacks to the body's most vulnerable points. Maximum effectiveness and efficiency in order to neutralize the opponent as quickly as possible. Maintaining awareness of surroundings while dealing with the threat. Learning to understand the psychology of a street confrontation, and identifying potential threats before an attack occurs This meetup group is for anyone who would like to learn Krav Maga. We can get together to learn Self Defense against any real world dangers and counter in the quickest and most efficient way. The intensity of these workouts will keep you physically fit, develop awareness and build confidence over time. I have asked a friend, David Ordini to show us some of the basics of Krav Maga. We can meetup once a week and learn self defense from a 9 year Krav Maga student who studied under the grand master. So come and join us at our next meetup, learn self defense, meet some new people and have fun.

results.description:
This is a group for those who like Blues, Country & Gospel Music. "The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!" are a unique entity in the NY/NJ music scene. They consider themselves the only guitar/vocal duo that mixes equal parts Rockabilly, Country and genuine guitar Gospel music with a spoonful of greasy Blues to wash it all down. Their influences include many seminal figures in American music, such as Hank Williams, Elvis Presley, Chuck Berry, Gene Vincent, Reverend Charlie Jackson, Howlin' Wolf, Wilbert Harrison, Arthur “Big Boy” Crudup, Sister Rosetta Tharpe, Brother Joe May, Charlie Feathers, Carl Perkins, Smiley Lewis, Brother Claude Ely and Lloyd Price, among many others. Watch them bring this amazing music alive at many great New York and New Jersey clubs and venues, and meet other like-minded fans of American Roots Music. This is not your father’s blues – it’s more like your grandfather’s…if your grandfather was a preacher in a Mississippi Baptist church.

What others are saying about "The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!":

"When you hit the stage, it was like we were hit with a bolt of lightning! Truly electrifying! Really brought the place to life! You guys owned the stage like few have at The Way Station." - James Coyle

"These guys are amazing. The closest thing to Hank Williams Sr. this side of Heaven." - Jim Chum

"Together Gary Van Miert and Malcolm Marsden form the Sensational Country Blues Wonders, one of the best throwback blues groups on any side of the Hudson -- and quite likely good enough to swell with the Mississippi." - The Jersey Journal

"These guys are the real musical anarchists." - David Huberman

“They call it Country/Blues/Gospel, I call it.... I don't even know. If the lovechild of Carl Perkins and Hank Williams became a preacher whose church had a liquor store and an opium den, you might come close to The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!” - Valdaniel Martins

We got there and the country group “The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!” started their set. To be completely honest, country has never really been my favorite genre, but these guys TOTALLY changed my mind on country music. I absolutely loved them!! - CHICpeaJC
results.name: "The Sensational Country Blues Wonders!"  Meetup Group

results.description: You're invited to join a group for parents with children whose behavior and learning problems suggest the possibility of Attention Deficit Disorder and/or Dyslexia. Many doctors, educators and parents express growing concern at the increasing number of young people being put on powerful medication for Attention Deficit Disorder, a condition often identified only by vague symptoms. A disproportionate number of young people are labeled and treated for A.D.D. in the U.S. compared to most other countries. This fact alarms many authorities, including law enforcement officials who now report high levels of abuse of A.D.D. and A.D.H.D.-related, prescribed drugs. Join us if your child: 1) Works slow, 2) Avoids reading, 3) Skips over words, 4) Reverses letters, or 5) Has poor reading comprehension.

Ten minutes will be upfront information on getting comfortable and the science around stress and meditation and then 30 minutes of guided meditation using the anchors of breath, sound and mantra. It's a great introduction for people who are interested but never felt inspired to start a meditation practice. It does a body and a mind a whole lot of good!  $5 donation, please. Thanks!

results.description: I recently lost my mother very suddenly, and have been surprised at how even NYC doesn't offer a support group for young adults who have lost a parent. While there are plenty of groups for kids and teens, older adults and even parentless parents, the "young adult" age range has been highly overlooked by bereavement support groups. Meanwhile, I have found it hard to relate to both people who lost parents in their teens or middle age; on the one hand, I had an adult relationship with my mother, but I also feel she will never get to see me finish "growing up" completely. On top of that, young adults are often living the most transitional, independent portions of their lives. Most of us here in NYC live away from family and our oldest friends, we are building careers, still figuring out who we are, experiencing the dizzying ups and downs of dating, and living in impermanent homes either alone or with strangers. My goal is to create a group who knows what it's like to be amidst the chaotic flows of young adult life while grieving the loss of a parent. This group is not so much based on age as it is what stage of life you feel you are in. If the above resonates with you, you are more than welcome to join. It does not matter how you lost your parent, or even if you are simply coping with a sick parent whom is still alive. Meetings will be casual, simple, fun, and relaxing -- a picnic at the park, a cool little restaurant, a warm bar, etc., and I strongly encourage all members to make suggestions. I just want to meet some new friends who are also figuring out how to live a good life under the heavy weight of grief, to hang out and heal in good company.
results.name: Young Adults Who Have Lost a Parent

results.description:
Welcome to NYC Beach Bums! 

Our meetup group is dedicated to get all the beach loving people of NYC to our events at Rockaway Beach and other NYC beaches this summer and start of fall. 

If you love to just chill on the beach with your friends, or if your a novice or an experienced boarder looking for a cool way to meet new people and have a great time then this club is for you.  

We offer a summer, & fall season club membership which includes regularly scheduled events to Rockaway Beach, and when the swells arrive we'll be posting events at Gilgo Beach and Ditch Plains! Later in the fall we'll be announcing some overnight trips to camp out and go surfing in Montauk right on the beach! 

The club has it's own 14 passenger van for transporting our members to our events and is outfitted with a custom roof rack to carry any type of gear to our events so bring your boards, coolers, couches, koozies... and whatever else you need!

We have a love for the Rockaway's and have been surfing there for over 20 years. It would be our pleasure to be your Rockaway sherpa and put you on to all the cool destination beaches there and the local hot spots to grab some of the best food, adult beverages, and parties in NYC right by the beach. 

Once the surf season is over we also run a meetup called NYC Go Wild Outdoor Club which runs from October - April and will be hosting trips up to some of the coolest parts of the Catskills and go to hidden swim holes, hiking, tubing, kayaking, camping, fishing, and throwing down some kick ass bbq's in the middle of nature. 

This is a real deal club and we're looking for a solid crew of members to have an awesome time with!

Looking forward to meeting you all!

Mahalo from your friends at NYC Beach Bums

Call us with any questions you may have 1.347.931.1600

*Our membership is currently open only to vegans and those who are aspiring to become vegan.*

results.description: This group will meet every Thursday night at 7:00 pm at The Immaculate Conception Church. We celebrate a healing Mass followed by adoration of The Blessed Sacrament. We pray for each other and as a group we pray for our spiritual growth and holiness. We forgive, we love, we embrace, we pray and we don't judge. Our goal is keeping the fire of our Lord blazing in our souls and make sure we are helping each other on the road to Heaven. Spiritual talks will be held from time to time. Come, let us pray together We need each other. Heaven is the house of God's family, be one. Love you all.
results.name: Tarrytown Spirituality Meetup/ praying, mediation & healing

results.description: This is the New York City Chapter of Women Who Go: http://www.meetup.com/Women-Who-Go/ This group is for you if: 1. You identify as a woman, publicly or privately. 2. You have some interest in the Go programming language, or programming in general.
results.name: NYC Women Who Go

results.description: This group is for adult only children who are looking for close friendships with others who can commiserate with the specific loneliness of being an only child. It gets harder to make new and close friends in your late 20s and 30s and many of my friends have become closer to their siblings and/or spouses as a result. I want to create a community of similarly situated individuals who lack a built in peer support network and who are open to creating close friendships. Let's share in new life milestones, the anxiety of having the aging or geographically distant parents, or just brunches, late night drinks and pep talks or whatever else it is that siblings do for each other.
results.name: Only Children Social Support Group

topics.name: people that like stand up comedy

results.description: Come to Solas for an intimate evening of hanging and stand up comedy. This show is a lot of fun and we like to say, it's the most free show in the East Village, every Fri-Sat-Sun at 7:30PM. Check it out! We love to hear from people who are interested in performing stand up, watching, and learning more. Plus, we're always down to hang out after. Come on out and have a good time with comics who have been on Comedy Central, Food Network, MTV, and more.
results.name: New York's East Village Stand-Up Comedy Meetup

results.description: THE GOLD ZONE is Bloomfield, NJ first co-working space.  We're sponsoring one free co-working days per month.   Visit our website at http://www.goldzonecoworking.com to find out more about us.  The Gold Zone gives community members, small businesses, and people looking to network the chance to "get in the zone" and work at a private workspace, in a small group meeting space, or in a large conference room!  Wouldn't like to work and have your meetings at some place other than Starbucks or Panera Bread?  Anyone looking for a place to work and meet new people is welcome to join!
results.name: Gold Zone CoWorking Space - Bloomfield NJ

results.description: You are a creative being, you're just not a consistent one. Schedules and deadlines sap your inspiration, and it really bums you out that most creative success requires consistency! Come and join together with fellow creatives that feel your pain. There will be guest speakers, group activities and the chance to create some low-pressure accountability around your creative projects.
results.name: Inconsistent Creatives Meetup

results.description: There are many great women's cycling groups in NYC, but this one will focus on the LBTQ community. We'll plan weekly trips of varying lengths (depending on interest) and usually work in a snack or lunch stop along the way.
results.name: Will Cycle for Food! (A Queer Women's Cycling Club)

results.description:
This is Daniel Jordano, actor and author of the humbly titled: "The Best Book on Acting: How to Become a Better Actor Instantly Without Killing Yourself with the Method"

If you are an actor, you've probably done your fair share of pointless exercises in classes: "Hold the imaginary teacup. Feel the warmth of the tea. Can you smell it? Can you smell it?" ...or you may have had your fill of "gurus" who may direct scenes, but don't give actors any understanding of how to get where they need to get--on their own!

Well we are launching a NEW workshop on Sept. 24th called “The Life Acting Workshop” where we don't have any gurus. We focus on each member putting up work in an atmosphere of helping one another using a simple and effective system called …LIFE ACTING...with an emphasis on ON CAMERA work.

Life Acting is summed up in the question: “What does your character want from the other actors/characters and how are you going to get it? At the current time, we are limited to 10 committed actors. The experience level is not the key issue here, but the willingness to make a commitment to the work.

Each workshop is only $25. Cash, Check made out to Veritas Arts International, or paypal: veritasartsinc@gmail.com

The initial one will take place from 7pm to 10pm on Thursday, September 24th My goal for this is to develop an encouraging and safe place to work and improve our craft as actors. I am serving as the facilitator. Not a guru. We will learn and be encouraged by ONE ANOTHER!
results.name: The Life Acting Workshop

results.description:
Write, Speak, and Teach is a meetup to create momentum for its members to create and ship great content.

If you are a writer, speaker, or teacher (or an author, podcaster, coach, or trainer) you need to get the word out about your work. Content marketing is the best way to get the word out and build your platform.

Content marketing means creating great content, in multiple formats, and then engaging with others about the content, in ways that creates more content, which builds your brand and visibility. 

In the process of creating content, your best effort and a deadline should be the goal, not perfection. 

Lets come together as a group in fun interactive ways, to learn, to take on the challenge of disciplined content creation, and to create momentum for ourselves and each other. 

This group requests member dues because we meet in NYC at a cool interactive space, which costs decent money.

Our first meetup will be a "Launch Some Work" challenge to get the ball rolling.

"Create and ship... create and ship..."
results.name: Write, Speak & Teach - Platform Builders Meetup

topics.name: Single Parents, Divorced Parents, Widowed Parents

results.description: We are a social group for LGBTQ Single Parents. Whether you are single by choice, divorce, or widowhood, this is a place for us to get together, socialize, share resources, and be proud of who we are. Whether you are a parent through biology, adoption, Donor Egg/Sperm, Surrogacy or Fostering, let's connect! Maybe you have been out since you were 12. Maybe you are just coming out. Either way, you are all included. Maybe you are just thinking of becoming a single LGBT parent, or perhaps you are already in the midst of trying and need encouragement and advice. All are welcome. All gender identities and queer sexual orientations are included. We meet in kid friendly spaces so we don't have to get babysitters. We go to the Gay Center Family Play Day together so we are not the only single parents there. We meet for a picnic in the park, or even sometimes go out for a night on the town. Let's unite! Get to know each other! Share struggles and celebrate our triumphs! We are amazing and we should all know each other!
results.name: LGBTQ Single Parents of New York City

results.description: I'm creating this group for women between the ages of 25 to 47 who love living and socializing in Brooklyn and want to make good friendships along the way. I really want this to be a space where women can bond over drinks and inevitably make friendships outside of meetup. So whether you grew up in Brooklyn or are new to this great borough - feel free to join! Im open to meetup suggestions but for now I'm just guaging interest level. I'm limiting the number of people in this group as I want to attract people who are serious about attending regularly, so again, this is a space where you can develop real friendships. If you have been inactive for 4 months or longer than I will likely remove you from the group. Thanks!
results.name: Brooklyn Girls Rock

results.description: I started a book club almost 2 years ago (October, 2013) with a small group of friends/family either living or working in NYC via an email distro and we're still going strong almost 2 years later. I wanted to start a meet up group in an effort to get more, new, exciting, different members to join! This book club meets once a month (we aim for the 2nd tuesday of each month, but it does change from time to time based on the availability of the sub-group of people interested in attending each month. This book club is super chill - come whenever you can come type of thing. We tend to meet at restaurants/cafes or at someone's apartment if they are able to host. There is no theme in terms of types of books we choose for the book club - I choose books for the the first half of the year and second half of the year ahead of time so that you know which books are in the pipeline/can decide which book to reach for the corresponding month. We have had so much fun and so many interesting discussions over the past 2 years - we would love to have you JOIN!!
results.name: NYC Chill/Anything goes/No themed Book Club!

results.description: A unique combination of martial arts and body movement, a moving meditation, that cultivates the spirit along with the mind and body, Shintaido means "new body way." Shintaido forms exemplify openness and freedom, providing a new way of experiencing our relationship with ourselves, others, nature, and the spiritual world. Explore this healing martial/meditative art and form in its natural dojo - outdoors in some of the finest landscapes in NYC.
results.name: Shintaido NYC Meetup
